chapter.title: Workforce Preparation Activities Meant to be Integrated into all Adult Education Services
chapter.content:
Workforce preparation activities are not intended as a set of separate, stand-alone services. Nor are they reserved only for programming designed explicitly to prepare students for a specific occupation, such as Integrated Education and Training, Career Pathways, or Integrated English Literacy and Civics Education.

Instead, workforce preparation activities are meant to be integrated into all levels of adult education services, regardless of whether the programming is designed to prepare students for a specific occupation or career pathway.

Explore LINCS and other federal resources for states and programs interested in developing career pathways to familiarize yourself with them. Bookmark those you feel are relevant to your classroom instruction.

Explore

The Federal Government has developed many, high-quality and in-depth resources for states and programs interested in developing career pathways, including:

  • The U.S. Department of Labor Career Pathways Toolkit: An Enhanced Guide and Workbook for System Development. Component 3.3 has several resources and tools around developing competency models that can be foundational to the development and design of a career pathway.
  • OCTAE’s suite of self-paced Career Pathways online courses: Building Strategic Partnerships, Developing Effective Bridge Programs; Designing Contextualized Instruction; Integrating Career Counseling and Planning into Adult Education; and Engaging Employers in Adult Career Pathways.
